org.xflatdb.xflat.query

Class NumericIntervalProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xflatdb.xflat.query.NumericIntervalProvider

  • public class NumericIntervalProvider
extends Object
    A class containing a number of factory methods for getting IntervalProvider objects for numbers. Each IntervalProvider provides fixed-width intervals calculated based on the width and base parameters to each function. The base is the offset on the number line from which to start, and the width is the size of each interval on the number line.

    Example:
    for base = 25 and width = 100, intervals would be the following:
    ... [-175, -75) [-75, 25) [25, 125) [125, 225) ...

    Author:
    Gordon

      • forInteger

        public static IntervalProvider<Integer> forInteger(int base,
                                   int width)
        Creates a IntervalProvider for Integer based intervals.
        Parameters:
        base - The base from which intervals should be calculated. Usually 0.
        width - The width of one interval.
        Returns:
        A IntervalProvider providing intervals based on these settings.
